data.title: What is balanitis?
data.normalized_content: Balanoposthitis is a condition in which the foreskin and glans become swollen, painful, and uncomfortable. The cause of the disease is often harmful microorganisms, commonly fungi, bacteria, viruses, and also parasites. (1) The foreskin is a thin layer of skin that covers the head of the penis and the urinary opening. When the penis becomes erect due to stimulation, the foreskin will be pulled down, revealing the head of the penis.

Nguyên nhân gây bệnh thường là do vi sinh vật có hại, phổ biến là nấm và vi khuẩn, virus, ngoài ra còn có ký sinh trùng. (1) Bao quy đầu là lớp bao da mỏng trùm lên đầu dương vật và phần lỗ tiểu. Dương vật khi cương lên do kích thích, phần bao quy đầu sẽ bị kéo xuống, để lộ phần đầu của dương vật.

data.title: Distinguish between balanitis and inflammation of the head of the penis
data.normalized_content: Balanitis is often confused with two diseases: phimosis and inflammation of the head of the penis (balanitis). All three conditions affect the penis. However, each disease affects a different part of the penis. (2) Phimosis is a condition in which the foreskin does not fully retract from the glans. Inflammation of the head of the penis (balanitis) is an inflammation of the glans. Balanitis is an inflammation of both the glans and foreskin. Phimosis can occur along with balanitis or balanitis. Phimosis can easily cause irritation of the glans and foreskin. Once this irritation occurs, symptoms such as pain and swelling can make it more difficult to retract the foreskin.
data.content: Viêm bao quy đầu thường bị nhầm lẫn với hai bệnh lý là hẹp bao quy đầu và viêm đầu dương vật (viêm quy đầu). Cả ba bệnh lý đều ảnh hưởng đến dương vật. Tuy nhiên, mỗi bệnh lý lại ảnh hưởng đến một bộ phận khác nhau của dương vật. (2) Hẹp bao quy đầu là tình trạng da bao quy đầu không tuột lên hoàn toàn khỏi quy đầu. Viêm đầu dương vật (viêm quy đầu) là tình trạng viêm nhiễm ở quy đầu. Viêm bao quy đầu là tình trạng viêm nhiễm cả quy đầu và bao quy đầu. Hẹp bao quy đầu có thể xảy ra cùng với viêm quy đầu hoặc viêm bao quy đầu. Tình trạng hẹp bao quy đầu dễ gây kích ứng quy đầu và bao quy đầu. data.title: cause of foreskin inflammation
data.normalized_content: There are many causes of foreskin inflammation. In particular, clearly identifying the cause will support more effective treatment of foreskin inflammation. Some common causes of balanitis include: (3) Phimosis: The disease prevents the head of the penis from being exposed to the outside, leading to difficulty in cleaning the head of the penis. Over time, urine residue and dirt will accumulate at the tip of the penis. This is a favorable opportunity for a series of bacteria and fungi to multiply and develop strongly. Unhealthy sex: Another common cause of balanitis is promiscuous sex, lacking safety measures, leading to an increased risk of sexually transmitted diseases such as syphilis and gonorrhea. ..., which means the risk of foreskin inflammation is very high. Not cleaning or improperly cleaning the genitals: Common causes in children. Because children do not have a sense of personal hygiene. Irritability: Balanitis can occur in patients who are easily irritated by the environment or laundry products, genital hygiene products, shower gel, shampoo, etc. , the foreskin will be red and itchy for a few days, then it will stop completely. Some diseases: Diseases such as urethritis or urinary tract infections also greatly increase the risk of balanitis.

data.title: complications of foreskin inflammation
data.normalized_content: Most cases of foreskin inflammation do not go away on their own without an appropriate treatment regimen. When severe, the disease can cause the penis to change shape, leading to many dangerous complications, seriously affecting men's daily lives. Therefore, when there are symptoms of foreskin inflammation, patients should quickly go to reputable medical facilities for timely examination, diagnosis and treatment, to prevent serious complications. If treatment is delayed, men may face complications such as: Onset of other inflammatory diseases: Bacteria, after entering, can cause ulcers in the foreskin to develop and penetrate deeper. into other agencies. They cause many inflammatory diseases such as vasculitis, orchitis, epididymitis... Reduced sexual desire: Foreskin inflammation causes men to always have pain. Therefore, patients often lose interest in sex. Over time, the disease can cause physiological dysfunction, erectile dysfunction, impotence, premature ejaculation... Infertility, infertility: Chronic balanitis can reduce quantity and quality sperm, thereby increasing the risk of infertility. Penile cancer: Foreskin inflammation accompanied by ulcers and pus discharge can increase the risk of penile cancer. Foreskin inflammation reduces sexual desire. In addition, foreskin inflammation can cause urethritis and cystitis. In some cases, kidney function may be affected, increasing the risk of kidney failure.

data.title: How to treat foreskin inflammation
data.normalized_content: 1. Use medication For mild inflammation, special oral medications (antibiotics, anti-inflammatory, anti-virus, pain and swelling reduction...) will help eliminate pathogens and quickly relieve symptoms. malaise. When treating diseases with antibiotics, doctors may prescribe certain groups of drugs such as: Antibiotics polymyxin, neomycin, penicillin, chloramphenicol, glycerine, sorbolene...: Treatment of inflammatory problems caused by bacteria. Antiviral drugs such as valacyclovir or famciclovir: May be prescribed if the balanitis is caused by a virus. When using antibiotics, patients should pay attention to a few important things to minimize the risk of the body developing antibiotic resistance: Make sure to use antibiotics at the correct dosage as prescribed by the doctor, not too much. and no less. Absolutely do not share your antibiotics with those around you. Because your medicine may not be suitable for someone else, even if they have the same disease. 2. Surgery For people with chronic inflammation who have been treated with medication but are ineffective, the doctor may recommend surgery to remove the foreskin. Currently, circumcision techniques are quite diverse, often prescribed based on each patient's age, health conditions and level of inflammation.
